Class ShowMessage

java.lang.Object
ShowMessage
public class ShowMessage extends Object
Just to clarify the design purpose There is an explanation on ED saying : If you were to create an entirely new methods and classes for things that already exist (e.g. write your Rectangle class) that might lead to mark deduction since it is overly complicated. This ShowMessage class seems Redundant however it allows hiding font details, it's part of specification of this game, which would be repeatable everytime. Also, what happens if a subsequent game comes along that requires calling java's own font class/function to draw text(e.g. java.awt.Font)? By simply adding judgments and new constructors to this class, I offer the possibility of encapsulating the abstraction of these changes. In addition, if there are requirements for the display, such as text dithering, rotation, etc., this can be achieved by overloading Show() in order not to repeatedly take up space in ShadowPac.java
